result.execSummary:
The defendant Damiso Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber Privileges for work, school and medical.
Sign up for probation no later than 10/29/2022.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay a fine of $100.00 INCLUDING all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/29/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Court approves of expungement pending the successful completion of probation.

- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Complete a firearm safety course.
- Complete a cognitive thinking course.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Damiso Lee

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Damiso Lee in court.  Attorney William F Sulton in court for Damiso Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TOC OUNT ONE; Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    

AS TO COUNT ONE; Defendant ordered to serve 20 DAYS in the House of Correction, Huber Privileges for work, school and medical. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 9 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/29/2022.
- Pay a fine of $100.00 INCLUDING all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
- Complete a firearm safety course.
- Complete a cognitive thinking course.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/29/2022 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept
- Court approves of expungement pending the successful completion of probation. 
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Damiso Lee not in court.  Attorney William F Sulton appeared by video for Damiso Lee.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Court waives defendant's appearance. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Damiso Lee in court with attorney William F Sulton.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Damiso Lee appeared by video means with Attorney who appeared in person.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests body camera footage from Wauwautosa Police Department.  Court orders state to turn over all discovery to defense counsel.  Court will allow defense counsel to submit an itemization of discovery needed.  Court will adjourn case to status conference/hearing to determine status of discovery.  Case adjourned, Br. 15.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed by Defense: Motion for Order permitting a deposition.

Defendant Damiso Lee in court with attorney William F Sulton.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of partial discovery and request the order to sign an order to permitting  a deposition.
State to follow up. Defense to efile a proposed order for the court to review. 
 Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/8/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Damiso Lee in court with attorney William F Sulton.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 19.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
